title: Cultural Competency & Ethical Standards Self-Certification Questionnaire
description: Self-certification questionnaire for cultural appropriateness and ethical behavior

metadata.purpose: Company policy compliance, not legally mandated

questions.text: Has the agent been tested for cultural appropriateness in target markets?
Which cultures/regions has the agent been tested for?
Does the agent use appropriate honorifics when communicating in languages that require them (e.g., Japanese keigo, Korean jondaenmal)?
Has the agent been trained on culturally diverse data?
Does the agent respect cultural norms around family information sharing (e.g., healthcare contexts)?

behavioral_safeguards.title: Behavioral Safeguards
behavioral_safeguards.description: Based on research documenting privacy violations and manipulation risks in AI systems

questions.text: Does the agent prevent unconsented user profiling (e.g., inferring gender, age, health status without explicit disclosure)?
Does the agent have safeguards against emotional manipulation (e.g., creating inappropriate emotional dependencies)?
Are there limits on anthropomorphization (e.g., preventing AI from appearing too human-like)?
Does the agent avoid making assumptions about users based on stereotypes?
Has the agent been red-teamed for manipulative or deceptive behaviors?
Does the agent support multiple languages?
Which languages are supported?
Has the agent been tested for bias across demographic groups?
Does the agent accommodate users with disabilities (e.g., screen reader compatibility)?
Is the carbon footprint / energy usage of the agent documented?
Estimated energy consumption per 1000 requests (kWh)
Does the provider use renewable energy for compute?
Has the agent been evaluated against any ethical AI benchmarks?
Which benchmarks/frameworks?
Third-party ethical audit conducted?
Auditor name and date

cooperative_alignment.title: Cooperative AI Alignment
cooperative_alignment.description: Assessment of cooperative vs compliance-focused AI governance orientation

questions.text: Is the AI designed to empower users to solve problems independently, rather than solving problems for them?
questions.help_text: Change Agent orientation: AI as enabler vs. controller

questions.text: Does the AI system incorporate feedback mechanisms for stakeholder input on system behavior?
Has the cultural origin of training data been disclosed to users?
Does the system respect data sovereignty requirements (e.g., data-in, model-out)?
Is there a shared accountability model between AI provider and deployer for outcomes?
Does the AI aim to preserve cultural diversity rather than impose universal standards?
